landingIntro:
Hello,
Welcome to the image database project .
if you have already registered a system, please enter it using the button.
The database is developed as part of a final project that is being carried out in the Department of Software Engineering and Information Systems at Ben-Gurion University.
Our goal is to create a database of beautiful images taken by amateur and professional photographers and understand how much people like each of them. To allow us to arrive at a reliable assessment of the beauty of the images, we ask that you view at least 70 images and give each of them a score that expresses How much do you like them? In our estimation, the time required is about 10 minutes.
The research is anonymous. We are interested in statistical data and not in personal data, so we do not collect any details about you. We would be happy if you later answer some demographic questions, but It's not mandatory, all you need is an email address so we can allow you to enter the system.
landingTitle: How much do you like this photo?
landingSubTitle: Enjoy beautiful photos, and help us build a dataset of aesthetic images in the process.
landingPart1: Welcome! We invite you to rate a set of beautiful photos in terms of how much you like each of them.
landingPart2: If you are already a registered rater, please enter using the ‚ÄúRegistered Users‚Äù button.
landingPart3: If you are not registered yet, please press ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù
landingPartContinute: If you are not registered yet,  please read the following information carefully before proceeding.
landingNum: people have taken this test so far.
landingSubHeadline1: Why we are doing this research:
landingSubText1: The primary goal of this project is to gather data on how much people like various photos.
landingSubHeadline2: What you will have to do:
landingSubText2: You will be asked to view at least 70 photos and rate how much you like each of them. All photos were taken by professional and amateur photographers. There are no ugly or offensive photos in this dataset! If you like the experiment, you can ask to view and rate additional photos during this session or in the future.
landingSubHeadline3: What you will get out of it:
landingSubText3: The experiment is not designed to benefit you, but you may enjoy watching and rating beautiful photos.
landingSubText4: There are no risks anticipated in taking part in this study, and you are free to leave at any time.
landingSubText5: Your responses will be kept anonymous. Any data that we collect will be securely stored on our servers. We asked several background questions for statistical analysis purposes, but you are not obliged to answer them. Also, we ask for your email address so you can re-enter the system multiple times if you like the experiment.
landingSubText6: The basic experiment takes approximately 10 minutes. However, some people find the task engaging and like to spend more time on it. This is possible, and we will allow you to continue rating photos indefinitely (well, almostüòä).
landingSubText7: If you have questions about this research, you may contact the research team at ....
checkboxAgreeExp: By clicking the ‚ÄúI agree‚Äú button, you confirm that you have read and understood the above and agree to take part in this research. Your participation is voluntary, and you are free to leave the experiment at any time by simply closing the web browser.
checkToAgree: It is not possible to continue without consent to participate in the project
FinishEvaluateSomeImages: Very nice, you have finished rate {{imagesNumber}} images. If you want to see more images, please choose "Display more images". To finish rating the images and exit the system, select "Finish"
FinishEvaluateAllImages: Very nice, you have finished rate {{imagesNumber}}. To finish rating the images and exit the system, select "Finish"
UsernamesError: The email addresses do not match, please try again
generalInstructions: Now we will show you all 70 images in a window when they are reduced. Hovering the mouse over each image will enlarge it a little, and clicking with the mouse on the image will enlarge it further. The scores for each image are given by dragging it to the appropriate cell on the right side of the screen. The system allows you to transfer images from one cell to another, until you feel that the grades for all the images do reflect your taste. We recommend that there be a similar (not necessarily the same) amount of images in the different grade cells. Basically, the more you like the image, the higher it should be in the cell with a higher score. For example, if you really like the picture, give it a score of 9 or 10. If you like it but not completely, give it a score of 7 or 8. And vice versa: give a score of 1 or 2 to pictures you don't like at all, and so on. After you finish rating the 70 images, you can choose between the option of seeing more images and rating them or end your participation.

finishExperiment: We appreciate your participation in the project! You can return to this site later using the email with which you have registered to view and rate up to 250 photos!. If you have any feedback on this project, please let us know by pressing the ‚ÄúFeedback‚Äù link. If you have not done so, you can also return here to update the background questions. This will help us in statistically analyzing the study‚Äôs result.
noParticipantsData: There is no participants data to present
